page.title: 10Village Life.
page.content: Marden is a very thriving village and has a great deal of life involving a broad spectrum of modern and traditional activities. Much of the normal country occupations such as farming, horticulture, horseriding, and liesure-time pursuits are present. Religious, political and educational groups tend to overlap and most people seem to wear several official "hats" at some time or other. Church, Pub, School, Trade and other organisations often pool resources to provide entertainment, assistance or to raise funds for some enterprise or other. Two examples of this are the Liaison committee, a body consisting of members of all the organisations, formed to programme the village calendar in an optimum fashion, and the village sports and fete, where funds are raised for specific items.
